thread.title: Cross country roundup: Unioto dominates SVC meet

title: Cross country roundup: Unioto dominates SVC meet
text:
Cross country roundup: Unioto dominates SVC meet Gazette Staff 1:34 a.m. EDT October 18, 2015 Buy Photo Local athletes participated in Saturday's SVC Cross Country championships at Unioto High School. Josh Anderson/For the Gazette Local athletes participated in Saturday's SVC Cross Country championships at Unioto High School. Josh Anderson/For the Gazette Local athletes participated in Saturday's SVC Cross Country championships at Unioto High School. Josh Anderson/For the Gazette Local athletes participated in Saturday's SVC Cross Country championships at Unioto High School. Josh Anderson/For the Gazette Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay 4 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Unioto dominates SVC Cross Country Meet 
With magnificent performance from basically everyone on its team, Saturday morning, Unioto breezed by its Scioto Valley foes to claim both boys and girls SVC cross country titles. 
On the boys side, senior David Magda continued to do what he does best: win. 
Magda finished first and won an individual conference crown with a time of 15:10 – 0:44 seconds faster than his closest competitor. 
Unioto’s Cole Clever was second with a mark of 15:54 while the Shermans’ Aaron LaPlante (16:15), Isaiah West (16:19) and Tucker Markko (16:19) finished third, fourth and fifth respectively. 
The seizing of the top five spots is believed to be the first ‘perfect score’ since Piketon accomplished the feat 27 years ago. 
Zane Trace’s Mark Scott (16:35) finished sixth, Piketon’s Austin Taylor (16:49) took seventh and Westfall’s Hayden Mink (16:49), Piketon’s Alex Blanton (16:50) and Westfall’s Jonas Proffitt (16:59) all followed. 
The Shermans won the meet as a team with a total of 15 points. Unioto was followed by Zane Trace (66), Westfall (75), Piketon (89), Huntington (103), Paint Valley (167) and Adena (196). 
There was also a familiar individual top place finish for the girls as Unioto’s Haley Wright cruised to yet another win for the Shermans with a time of 18:19. 
Adena’s Taylor Clarkson cracked the top five, coming in second at 19:30. However, the remaining three spots in the top five belonged to Shermans — Alex Evans (18:43), Elena Knipp (18:53) and Tessa Sylvester (18:59). 
Rounding out the top ten individual finishes was Westfall’s Mackinley Trapp (19:20), Zane Trace’s Ivy Beam (19:23), Unioto’s Abbey Mohan (19:36), Zane Trace’s Alison Chinn (20:06) and Zane Trace’s Mckenzie Ray (20:29). 
Team wise, Unioto had no troubles winning the meet with 21 total points. The Shermans’ average time of 18:54 – 1:34:30 total – was the fastest average time ever ran, on the girls side, under coach Matt Paxton. 
Following Unioto in team finishers was Zane Trace (52), Westfall (74), Adena (123), Huntington (136), Paint Valley (156) and Southeastern (186). 
All SVC teams will now look towards next Saturday’s district events. The Southeast district cross country meets will be held held at Rio Grande University. 
Waverly sweeps Southern Ohio Conference Meet 
Also coming through with a dominant performance was the Waverly Tigers’ boys and girls cross country teams. 
On the boys side, the Tigers won the meet with 29 points. They were followed by Minford (70), Green (86), South Webster (100), Eastern (105), Wheelersburg (121), Notre Dame (185) and Northwest (191). 
Individually, junior Hunter Hoover won a conference title as well with a mark of 16:50. Also placing in the top ten for Waverly was Alec Parker (fifth, 17:52), Brenden Reed (sixth, 18:00), Trevor Penrod (eighth, 18:45) and Brody Sibole (ninth, 18:55). 
The Tigers’ girls also won their event with a total of 23 points, followed by South Webster (48) and Minford (63). 
Individually, Jamie Welch was the SOC champion with a time of 20:02. Also placing in the top ten for Waverly was Hannah Goodman (fourth, 21:40), Leta Heigley (sixth, 21:59), Gabby Towler (seventh, 22:20) and Kiara Smith (ninth, 23:20). 4 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://ohne.ws/1ROXCG1 TOP VIDEOS
